io.atomix.group

Interface GroupMember

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    LocalMember

    public interface GroupMember
    A DistributedGroup member representing a member of the group controlled by a local or remote process.
    Author:

      • Nested Class Summary

        Nested Classes 
        Modifier and Type Interface and Description
        static class  GroupMember.Status
        Status constants for indicating whether a member is currently connected to the group.

      • Method Summary

        All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
        Modifier and Type Method and Description
        String id()
        Returns the member ID.
        MessageClient messaging()
        Returns the direct message client for this member.
        <T> Optional<T> metadata()
        Returns the metadata associated with this member.
        Listener<GroupMember.Status> onStatusChange(Consumer<GroupMember.Status> callback)
        Registers a member status change listener.
        GroupMember.Status status()
        Returns the member's last known status.

    • Method Detail

      • id

        String id()
        Returns the member ID.

        The member ID is guaranteed to be unique across the cluster. Depending on how the member was constructed, it may be a user-provided identifier or an automatically generated UUID.

        Returns:
        The member ID.

      • status

        GroupMember.Status status()
        Returns the member's last known status.

        The member's status indicates whether the member is GroupMember.Status.ALIVE or GroupMember.Status.DEAD based on whether the member's session is open. Note that the consistency of client-side events is SEQUENTIAL, meaning all group instances will see status changes in the same order some time after the event actually occurred (asynchronously). So, even if a member's status is GroupMember.Status.DEAD from the perspective of one node, it may be GroupMember.Status.ALIVE from the perspective of another. Users should elect leaders to coordinate change in response to member status changes.

        Returns:
        The member status.

      • onStatusChange

        Listener<GroupMember.Status> onStatusChange(Consumer<GroupMember.Status> callback)
        Registers a member status change listener.

        The status change listener will be called when a member's session expires.

        The member's status indicates whether the member is GroupMember.Status.ALIVE or GroupMember.Status.DEAD based on whether the member's session is open. Note that the consistency of client-side events is SEQUENTIAL, meaning all group instances will see status changes in the same order some time after the event actually occurred (asynchronously). So, even if a member's status is GroupMember.Status.DEAD from the perspective of one node, it may be GroupMember.Status.ALIVE from the perspective of another. Users should elect leaders to coordinate change in response to member status changes.

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be called when the member's status changes.
        Returns:
        The status listener context.

      • messaging

        MessageClient messaging()
        Returns the direct message client for this member.

        The message client can be used to send direct messages to this member. To send a direct message, create a producer via the returned MessageClient. 

           
   GroupMember member = group.member("foo");
   MessageProducer<String> producer = member.messaging().producer("bar");
   producer.send("baz");
        Returns:
        The direct message client for this member.

      • metadata

        <T> Optional<T> metadata()
        Returns the metadata associated with this member.

        Metadata is provided when the member joins the group. If metadata was provided by the member when it joined the group, it is guaranteed to be visible to all nodes once the member has been added to the group.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The metadata type.
        Returns:
        The member metadata.
